item.title: Voltage controlled current source
item.description: Design I needed a voltage controlled current source (VCCS) to test some current limiting devices. A friend who knows far more than I about analog electronics recommended using a power op-amp, which is an op-amp capable of outputting a high current. I didn’t have one of these to hand, so used a regular low power op-amp to drive the gate of an N-type MOSFET. I think that a power op-amp is just a regular op-amp with some meaty FETs inside and a package capable of disappating more heat than a regular puny op-amp.
